{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3160301,"name":"","username":"techno_11","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/65b543/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-03-08T20:49:51.864Z","cooked":"

Yesterday evening was trouble shooting some weird issues with a SPARK Max + PWM + CIM motor drivetrain.

The issue in question here was random “Chattering” of the CIM motors. This is a bog-standard kit chassis, 4-CIM motor drive. Nothing special. Yes, we replaced both shafts. Ruled out the code by throwing together a fresh blank Java project, not that. Dropped the gearbox and ran it in our hands. No issues, gears mesh nicely. When this erratic “chattering” happened, the lights on the SPARK Maxes kinda wigged out. Within the Rev hardware client, I updated the firmwares all around, set the motor modes to Brushed, set the current limit to 120, disabled the forward and reverse limits, cleared sticky faults, and disabled the encoder. Nothing. Still random chattering.

As a last resort, we found an 2 old Vex Victor SPs and threw them in there. No changes to the code, just swap PWM and output (and disconnected the 2nd motor on each gearbox from the spark maxes). Boom. Smooth as butter. No issues whatsoever.

This morning, I came back to troubleshoot some more, knowing that these are nice motor controllers and shouldn’t have any issues, over PWM or CAN. Swapped the motors from PWM to CAN and hooked them up. Updated the program and no issues. Smooth driving, no chattering.

Any thoughts on what we might’ve been experiencing? I find it hard to believe the SPARK Maxes can’t be used over PWM… since they ship the dang wire in the box. Thanks in advance

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2023-03-08T21:30:43.245Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":51,"reads":71,"readers_count":70,"score":269.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":429445,"topic_slug":"weird-issue-with-spark-maxes-w-brushed-motors-and-pwm-control","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":42260,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/weird-issue-with-spark-maxes-w-brushed-motors-and-pwm-control/429445/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3160352,"name":"Fletch","username":"Fletch1373","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletch1373/{size}/220073_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-08T21:55:20.611Z","cooked":"

I know REV tests things fairly thoroughly, so i also have a hard time believing PWM simply doesn’t work. That said, PWM with SparkMaxes is VERY infrequently used, so if there were an issue, I’m not sure how quickly we’d hear about it. I don’t see any strong arguments for not using CAN, especially if you already have it setup and working for testing purposes.

For the PWM issue, sharing a video clip of what you’re seeing might be helpful since “chattering” could mean a couple different things. If you do so, make sure the LED is clearly visible so we can correlate that as well. Also, I know you said you ruled it out by trying a fresh project, but sharing code might help.

Finally, you can always contact REV support.

Thanks. I don’t know if I’ll be able to get any videos as this team will be competing this weekend. Like you mentioned, I find it difficult to believe as well. But, over CAN it shall be, at least until I can potentially test out the PWM again. Thanks!

I’d recommend you reduce the current limits below 80A.

What do your driver station logs show when this happens, are you browning out? If your voltage is dropping <8v that is usually an indicator you’re pulling too much current.
